summary:
In 1989, a woman was attacked in Central Park, New York. Five teenagers (the Central Park Five) were wrongly accused and convicted, despite DNA evidence suggesting otherwise. They spent years in prison. Later, a serial rapist confessed, proving their innocence.

This case grabbed national attention, first highlighting crime in New York, and later, racial injustice. The Five were exonerated in 2002 and received a $41 million settlement from the city in 2014 for their wrongful imprisonment and the discrimination they faced.
title: Central Park jogger case
